alert.note: Alert for Norman (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 21 at 9:08PM CST until February 22 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph. * WHERE...In Minnesota, Norman County. In North Dakota, Traill, Griggs and Steele Counties. * WHEN...Until noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce the visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the Tuesday morning commute. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
